Comment: I'm just gonna throw out a historical note; - Bloody Mary refers to Henry VIII's daughter 'Mary Tudor'. She wasn't actually a frightening woman, she got the nickname 'Bloody Mary' because she burned numerous Protestants during her reign, as she was very Catholic. However, other Catholic monarchs in this period killed far more than her, and it's literally just a name that stuck. There's nothing sinister about saying 'Bloody Mary'. You might as well repeat "Mary Tudor" over and over, same effect.

Comment:
I can see why some horror amateurs would find this scary. But the funny thing about this series is that they take the found footage genre and try their best to make it as unrealistic as possible. Demons lunging at cameras? People uselessly filming everyday encounters? HD cameras in 1988? Lmao give me a break. If you're going to make a found footage movie, go all the way(BWP).

By the way, you're only paying for about 15-20 minutes worth of entertainment at the theaters; so much useless filler.

I'm not saying this at all to sound bad ass (since the first two and Insidious made me jump like a bitch), but the third didn't make jump once. Maybe the burning house was post-credits or something.
